intro: Deguelia rariflora, commonly known as the rare-flower deguelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive floral structure. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a unique, spurred shape that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Deguelia rariflora is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
